TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant ’s neighbours , PERSON and PERSON , who lived on the second floor of a QUANTITY dwelling house , reconstructed their CARDINAL flats . As a result of this , the applicant ’s flat on the first floor of the same house and the property in it were flooded and damaged .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a civil claim with ORG against PERSON and PERSON , by which she asked it to declare unlawful the reconstructions they had made , sought elimination of obstacles in using the house and claimed damages . Subsequently , the applicant lodged a similar claim against the local authorities , by which she also sought refutation of information published in a local newspaper concerning the applicant ’s alleged failure to pay for the utilities and claimed damages in this respect .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE the proceedings were suspended pending the outcome of the applicant ’s criminal complaint concerning the matter , which was eventually dismissed as unsubstantiated .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court discontinued the proceedings in respect of PERSON because of his death .

CARDINAL . Following CARDINAL reconsiderations of the case , on DATE the court allowed in part the applicant ’s claim , declared the reconstructions made by PERSON unlawful , obliged her to repair the house and the applicant ’s flat and ordered PERSON to pay the applicant certain amounts in compensation . The court rejected , as unsubstantiated , the applicant ’s claim against the local authorities .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE , respectively , ORG and ORG ( the latter court acting as a court of cassation ) upheld the above judgment . On DATE the applicant was served with a copy of the decision of DATE .

CARDINAL . According to the Government , in the course of the proceedings the applicant amended or specified her claims on CARDINAL occasions and on CARDINAL occasion she requested the courts to extend the time - limit for lodging her appeal . CARDINAL hearings were adjourned upon the applicant ’s request or due to her failure to attend them . CARDINAL hearings were adjourned mainly due to the CARDINAL parties’ failure to attend them and because of the absence of the judge . CARDINAL expert examinations were ordered in the course of the proceedings and lasted for DATE ( in DATE and in DATE ) .
CARDINAL . NORP The applicant disagreed that she had been responsible for the adjournment of some of the hearings mentioned by the Government .
